snippet: Duval, then 18, received a diagnosis of Hodgkin’s lymphoma, a cancer of the lymphatic system, the day before her first qualifying match at Wimbledon. She stayed and played.
abstract: Profile of Victoria Duval, 19-year-old who found out she had Hodgkin's lymphoma day before 2014 Wimbledon qualifying match, and who persisted at tournament nonetheless; Duval has returned to tennis following chemotherapy and hopes to receive wild card to participate in US Open.
lead_paragraph: Duval, then 18, received a diagnosis of Hodgkin’s lymphoma, a cancer of the lymphatic system, the day before her first qualifying match at Wimbledon. She stayed and played.

headline.main: Winning Mantra of ‘I’m Not Sick’ Propels Victoria Duval
headline.print_headline: Winning Mantra of ‘I’m Not Sick’ Propels a Player
